problem_text: The perpendicular bisectors of \triangle RST meet at point D. Find DT.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: 9 = DS, ∠TAS, A on RT, 4.68 = CD, ∠CRT, CR ⊥ CS, CS, ∠RCT, D on CR, CD ⊥ CT, ∠CTR, ∠DST, ∠CRA, AD ⊥ AR, CD, ∠RCS, ∠AST, CD ⊥ CS, 16 = RT, C on ST, ∠STR, AD ⊥ AT, DS, CT, D on AS, DT

Step 2:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 9 = DS, 4.68 = CD
Conclusions: 7.69 = SqrtOf(DS ** 2 - CD ** 2)

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : A on RT, ∠CRT
Conclusions: ∠CRA = ∠CRT

Step 4:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : CR ⊥ CS
Conclusions: (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠RCS

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠RCT, D on CR
Conclusions: ∠DCT = ∠RCT

Step 6:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : CD ⊥ CT
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠DCT

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : A on RT, ∠CTR
Conclusions: ∠CTA = ∠CTR

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CRA, D on CR
Conclusions: ∠CRA = ∠DRA

Step 9:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AD ⊥ AR
Conclusions: (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠RAD

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠RCS, D on CR
Conclusions: ∠DCS = ∠RCS

Step 11:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : CD ⊥ CS
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠SCD

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠DST, C on ST
Conclusions: ∠DSC = ∠DST

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : A on RT, ∠STR
Conclusions: ∠STA = ∠STR

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on ST, ∠STR
Conclusions: ∠CTR = ∠STR

Step 15:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : AD ⊥ AT
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TAD

Step 16:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : CS, DS, CD
Conclusions: △CDS

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠TAS, D on AS
Conclusions: ∠TAD = ∠TAS

Step 18:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : D on CR, D on AS
Conclusions: ∠CDS = ∠RDA

Step 19:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠AST, D on AS
Conclusions: ∠AST = ∠DST

Step 20:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : DT, CD, CT
Conclusions: △CDT

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠RCS, (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠RAD, ∠DCS = ∠RCS
Conclusions: ∠DCS = ∠RAD

Step 22:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DCT = ∠RCT, pi / 2 = ∠SCD, pi / 2 = ∠DCT
Conclusions: ∠RCT = ∠SCD

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CTR = ∠STR, ∠CTA = ∠CTR
Conclusions: ∠CTA = ∠STR

Step 24:
Theorem: Pythagorean Theorem
Premises : △CDS, CD ⊥ CS
Conclusions: CS = SqrtOf(DS ** 2 - CD ** 2)

Step 25:
Theorem: Perimeter Definition
Premises : △CDS
Conclusions: Perimeter(△CDS) = CD + CS + DS

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠TAD = ∠TAS, pi / 2 = ∠TAD, pi / 2 = ∠SCD
Conclusions: ∠SCD = ∠TAS

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠AST = ∠DST, ∠DSC = ∠DST
Conclusions: ∠AST = ∠DSC

Step 28:
Theorem: Pythagorean Theorem
Premises : △CDT, CD ⊥ CT
Conclusions: DT = SqrtOf(CD ** 2 + CT ** 2)

Step 29:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠CDS = ∠RDA, ∠DCS = ∠RAD
Conclusions: △ADR ~ △CDS

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠STA = ∠STR, ∠CTA = ∠STR, ∠CTA = ∠CTR
Conclusions: ∠CTR = ∠STA

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 7.69 = SqrtOf(DS ** 2 - CD ** 2), CS = SqrtOf(DS ** 2 - CD ** 2)
Conclusions: 7.69 = CS

Step 32:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠SCD = ∠TAS, ∠AST = ∠DSC
Conclusions: △AST ~ △CSD

Step 33:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △ADR ~ △CDS
Conclusions: ∠CSD = ∠DRA, ∠DCS = ∠RAD

Step 34:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 9 = DS, 7.69 = CS, Perimeter(△CDS) = CD + CS + DS, 4.68 = CD
Conclusions: 21.37 = Perimeter(△CDS)

Step 35:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △AST ~ △CSD
Conclusions: ∠AST = ∠DSC, ∠CDS = ∠STA

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CSD = ∠DRA, ∠CRA = ∠DRA, ∠CRA = ∠CRT
Conclusions: ∠CRT = ∠CSD

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CDS = ∠STA, ∠CTR = ∠STA
Conclusions: ∠CDS = ∠CTR

Step 38:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠CRT = ∠CSD, ∠RCT = ∠SCD, ∠CDS = ∠CTR
Conclusions: △CDS ~ △CTR

Step 39:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △CDS ~ △CTR
Conclusions: CD / CT = Perimeter(△CDS) / Perimeter(△CRT), ∠RCT = ∠SCD, sim_ratio_triangle_c_d_s_triangle_c_t_r = Perimeter(△CDS) / Perimeter(△CRT), sim_ratio_triangle_c_d_s_triangle_c_t_r = DS / RT, ∠CDS = ∠CTR

Step 40:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : CD / CT = Perimeter(△CDS) / Perimeter(△CRT), 21.37 = Perimeter(△CDS), 4.68 = CD
Conclusions: 21.37 / Perimeter(△CRT) = 4.68 / CT

Step 41:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_c_d_s_triangle_c_t_r = Perimeter(△CDS) / Perimeter(△CRT), 21.37 = Perimeter(△CDS)
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_c_d_s_triangle_c_t_r = 21.37 / Perimeter(△CRT)

Step 42:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_c_d_s_triangle_c_t_r = DS / RT, 9 = DS, 16 = RT
Conclusions: 9 / 16 = sim_ratio_triangle_c_d_s_triangle_c_t_r

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_c_d_s_triangle_c_t_r = 21.37 / Perimeter(△CRT), 9 / 16 = sim_ratio_triangle_c_d_s_triangle_c_t_r
Conclusions: 9 / 16 = 21.37 / Perimeter(△CRT)

Step 44:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 21.37 / Perimeter(△CRT) = 4.68 / CT, 9 / 16 = 21.37 / Perimeter(△CRT)
Conclusions: 8.32 = CT

Step 45:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 4.68 = CD, 8.32 = CT
Conclusions: 9.55 = SqrtOf(CD ** 2 + CT ** 2)

Step 46:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 9.55 = SqrtOf(CD ** 2 + CT ** 2), DT = SqrtOf(CD ** 2 + CT ** 2)
Conclusions: 9.55 = DT
